description: Oscar-winning actress Julia Roberts was so starstruck she appears to have accidentally trolled Real Madrid star Sergio Ramos after his team's 3-2 El Clasico loss to Barcelona.
title: Julia Roberts in gaffe with Real Madrid star Sergio Ramos
title_page: Julia Roberts in gaffe with Real Madrid star Sergio Ramos | Daily Mail Online
text:
Julia Roberts was so starstruck she appears to have accidentally trolled Real Madrid star Sergio Ramos after his team's El Clasico loss to Barcelona.
Following the conclusion of the epic El Clasico on Sunday, Roberts was invited to take a look round the Bernabeu and meet some of the the team's stars.
In a video posted to Real Madrid's Instagram account, Roberts is seen greeting Cristiano Ronaldo who seemed happy to embrace the actress despite the disappointing result.
Julia Roberts congratulates Sergio Ramos on his performance despite the defender's red card
Ramos smiles as he poses with Roberts despite the actress's ill-advised praise for his display
Ramos was dimissed by referee Alejandro Hernandez for a bad challenge on Lionel Messi
And shortly after Ramos is the next star introduced to Roberts and her husband cinematographer Daniel Moder.
But as Ramos prepares to pose with Roberts for a photo of the two together, the Oscar winner blurted out some rather unwarranted praise to the defender.
Ramos was dismissed with 13 minutes remaining in the pivotal La Liga clash for a wild lunge at Lionel Messi but Roberts clearly felt the performance still deserved some recognition as she comically told the Spaniard: 'You played amazing tonight.'
Roberts also met Real Madrid star Cristiano Ronaldo along with several other Madrid players
Barcelona's matchwinner Messi met actress Julia Roberts after his side's victory in El Clasico
Despite the offbeat comment the Spanish defender seemed unbothered and continued smile as he stood for the photo with the Pretty Woman actress.
Roberts also got to meet two-goal star Messi as well as fellow Madrid players Marcelo, Luka Modric, Lucas Vazquez and manager Zinedine Zidane.
Ramos's red card, the 22nd of his Real career, came before James Rodriguez pulled the scores level at 2-2 but Messi later scored a dramatic injury-time winner to steal the three points from ten-man Madrid.
The result moved Barcelona ahead of Zinedine Zidane's side in the title race though Madrid have played a game less than the Catalans heading into the final stretch.
